creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
we have a mechanism in place that allows modules to create their own patches in
the root sitemap.xmap, by placing patchfiles in config/sitemap.
these are currently named FOO.xmap. we have agreed before that all patchfiles
should end in .xconf.
moreover, it seems odd that we have a subdirectory cocoon-xconf, but sitemap
patches are not in it.

i propose the following:
move $MODULE/config/sitemap to $MODULE/config/cocoon-xconf/sitemap
move $MODULE/config/cocoon-xconf/sitemap/*xmap to {...}.xconf

currently, sitemap patchfiles exist in the following places:

./modules/sitetree/config/sitemap
./modules-legacy/task/config/sitemap
./modules-core/ac/config/sitemap
./modules-core/usecase/config/sitemap
./modules-core/workflow/config/sitemap
./modules-core/linking/config/sitemap
./webapp/lenya/config/sitemap

(In reply to comment #0)
> we have a mechanism in place that allows modules to create their own patches in
> the root sitemap.xmap, by placing patchfiles in config/sitemap.
> these are currently named FOO.xmap. we have agreed before that all patchfiles
> should end in .xconf.

Have we? IIRC this applies only to patch files for cocoon.xconf.
In Cocoon, patch files for sitemaps also end with .xmap.

> moreover, it seems odd that we have a subdirectory cocoon-xconf, but sitemap
> patches are not in it.

They aren't in there because they don't patch cocoon.xconf ...

> i propose the following:
> move $MODULE/config/sitemap to $MODULE/config/cocoon-xconf/sitemap
> move $MODULE/config/cocoon-xconf/sitemap/*xmap to {...}.xconf

-1

IMO it should be left as it is now.
